Field Detail

recordedMoments

private final java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentNavigableMap<java.lang.Long,java.lang.String> recordedMoments
Object "recordedMoments": the storage for moments recorded by this Stopwatch. As a ConcurrentNavigableMap, recordedMoments is thread-safe. It is also navigable by its keys, which are the monotonically increasing values from System.nanoTime(), represented as Long objects.

recordedMomentsGuard

private static final java.lang.Object recordedMomentsGuard
This object exists only to guard synchronization to "recordedMoments".

creationMoment

private long creationMoment
The time that the stopwatch was created, in timeNanos() form.

firstMoment

private long firstMoment
The time that the stopwatch first recorded a moment or task, in timeNanos() form.

previousMoment

private long previousMoment
The time of the most-recently-recorded moment, in timeNanos() form. This is cached for efficiency only, and is used in momentAdd() and momentsRetrieve().

public StopwatchImpl(java.lang.String title)
Construct a StopwatchImpl object.

Method Detail

momentAdd

private final long momentAdd(java.lang.String title)
Add a moment to the chronological set of moments that this Stopwatch records. Maintains the cache of creationMoment, firstMoment, and previousMoment.

Returns:
the value of previousMoment.

momentRecord

public long momentRecord(java.lang.String title)
Record a named moment.

Specified by:
momentRecord in interface Stopwatch
Parameters:
title - the text to use as the identifier of this moment.
Returns:
a long that is the elapsed time since the previous moment was recorded. If no previous moment has been recorded using momentRecord(), taskBegin(), or taskEnd(), the elapsed time interval measures the time between the creation of the Stopwatch object and this call.

taskBegin

public long taskBegin(java.lang.String title)
Record the beginning of a named task.

Specified by:
taskBegin in interface Stopwatch
Parameters:
title - the text to use as the identifier of this moment. The title is prefixed with the text "TaskBegin:".
Returns:
a long that is the elapsed time since the previous moment was recorded. If no moments have been recorded using momentRecord(), taskBegin(), or taskEnd(), the elapsed time interval measures the time between the creation of the Stopwatch object and this call.

taskEnd

public long taskEnd(java.lang.String title)
Record the end of a named task.

Specified by:
taskEnd in interface Stopwatch
Parameters:
title - the text to use as the identifier of this moment. The title is prefixed with the text "TaskEnd:".
Returns:
a long that is the elapsed time since the previous moment was recorded. If no moments have been recorded using momentRecord(), taskBegin(), or taskEnd(), the elapsed time interval measures the time between the creation of the Stopwatch object and this call.

momentsRetrieve

public java.util.List<Stopwatch.Moment> momentsRetrieve(Stopwatch.IntervalReportType intervalType)
Return a List of Moment objects that represents the state of the Stopwatch at the time of the call. This method is thread-safe and returns a copy of the Stopwatch state. Changes in the list are not reflected in the Stopwatch itself. Note that if multiple threads use the same Stopwatch object, the List may contain Moments that "the current thread" did not create.

Specified by:
momentsRetrieve in interface Stopwatch
Parameters:
intervalType - a IntervalReportType object.
Returns:
a List containing Moment objects, in the order in which they were recorded by the Stopwatch.

titleGet

public java.lang.String titleGet()
Get the title string of the Stopwatch object that was given when the object was created.

Specified by:
titleGet in interface Stopwatch
Returns:
the title String of this Stopwatch

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Return a String representation of the Moments in this Stopwatch. Overrides Object.toString().

Specified by:
toString in interface Stopwatch
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a String representation of the Moments in this Stopwatch, in previousMomentRelative format.
See Also:
toStringAsIntervals

toStringAsIntervals

public java.lang.String toStringAsIntervals(Stopwatch.IntervalReportType thisReportType)
Return a String representation of the Moments in this Stopwatch, in which the representation of Moments is selected from one of the Stopwatch.IntervalReportType values: nanoTimeValue, previousMomentRelative, or creationMomentRelative. These values result in displaying the raw value returned from System.nanoTime(), or the interval between a given moment and its previous moment, or the interval between a given moment and the original moment.

Specified by:
toStringAsIntervals in interface Stopwatch
Parameters:
thisReportType - a Stopwatch.IntervalReportType object.
Returns:
a String representation of the Moments in this Stopwatch
See Also:
IntervalReportType

prettyPrint

public java.lang.String prettyPrint(Stopwatch.IntervalReportType thisReportType)
Produce a nicely-formated text representation of the Stopwatch and its recorded moments.

This differs from toString() in that the text lines are indented to show the nesting of TaskBegin and TaskEnd moments.

There is an unspecified limit to depth of indentation.

If the caller has not provided balanced calls to taskBegin() and taskEnd(), the output will be complete but will not be pretty.

Specified by:
prettyPrint in interface Stopwatch
Parameters:
thisReportType - one of the enum values from Stopwatch.IntervalReportType
Returns:
a formatted text representation of the Stopwatch's state

prettyPrint

public java.lang.String prettyPrint()
Produce a nicely-formated text representation of the Stopwatch and its recorded moments, using the creationMomentRelative format.

If the caller has not provided balanced calls to taskBegin() and taskEnd(), or the indentation limit has been exceeded, the output will be complete but will not be pretty.

Specified by:
prettyPrint in interface Stopwatch
Returns:
a String object.
See Also:
prettyPrint(Stopwatch.IntervalReportType thisType)
